newsitem.title: USA: Two indicted after Wells Fargo theft in Ohio.
newsitem.headline: Two indicted after Wells Fargo theft in Ohio.

text.p: Two people were indicted by a U.S. grand jury in connection with the November theft of about $2.5 million in currency from a Wells Fargo office in Youngstown, Ohio, a federal prosecutor said on Monday.

Leesa D. Mazon, 27, of Struthers, Ohio, who was a Wells Fargo employee, and Jeffery John Chicase, 33, of Poland, Ohio, were charged with conspiracy and bank larceny, Emily Sweeney, U.S. Attorney for the Northern District of Ohio, said in a statement. In addition, Chicase was charged with receiving stolen property, she said.
Wells Fargo is a unit of Borg-Warner Security Corp.
If convicted, Mazon could face up to 15 years in prison and Chicase could face up to 20 years, Sweeney said. The two could also be fined, Sweeney said.
